element.name: Howth Cliff Walk - Martello Tower by Bootle, Traditional Cache (1/3.5)
element.description: The final of 6 caches along the Howth Cliff Walk.
element.long-description:
The Howth Cliff Walk offers the walker a fine, varied walk around an open hillside and the Howth cliffs, with the guarantee of plentiful bird life, excellent sea views and colourful wild flowers.
The walk can be commenced at many different places along the route, with many easy access points from various car parks that are conveniently located close to the path. This caching trail commences at the car park 1km to the east of the village (N53 23.137 W6 03.048) and moves slowly south, then west, but can also be undertaken in a reverse order.
While the main walk is generally not very steep, a couple of caches may require some scrambling up brief stretches of steep terrain. As always in Ireland it is advised to bring along good waterproof clothing for the inevitable shower. Sturdy footware is also a must. If you wish to undertake the entire walk in one go it makes sense to bring a packed lunch and plenty of liquids, as the full journey may take in the region of 4-5 hours.
This cache is located near the end of the cliff walk. You will be close to a Martello Tower that looks to have been abandoned half way through some form of restoration, leaving it in an ugly confused state! Hopefully you will get a good view across Dublin Bay. From here you can either walk back along the Cliff Path, or move on to Sutton for several well earned pints!

ul.li:
2010-06-16T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by RoobyDoo
From the clue this was the obvious place to look, but again from the clue, the cache has obviously gone. Lovely walk and views compensated the DNF though. RD

2010-06-14T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Gruntplace
Too many muggles. Was going to drop off Georgia's Travel Slug but headed for 'Views of Howth' instead. Great views here too

2010-05-30T19:00:00Z : Found it by didi2206
Took a while to actually put our hands on it.. so small but got it eventually.. what a nice view of the bay, we will do the whole cliff walk soon TFTC

2010-05-30T19:00:00Z : Found it by SharpSwords
Nice easy find with friends! played in the long grass afterwards and everytime we saw a muggle we would either hide in the grass or shout muggles! It was a nice day and the sun was shining. We had capri-suns and a lot of fun! [ :D ] [ ;) ]

2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by tmob
#2407
We looked for this cache during our holidays in Ireland. Six fantastic days, 1800kms driven, and a bunch of caches found. Definitely a great way to get to know this beautiful island!
The first one of this walk series. Great place, this coast line is amazing. We really enjoyed the walk.
Thanks for this one... Greetings from Portugal

2008-02-16T20:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
We decided to tackle the cliff walk in reverse order, so this was our first stop for the day. A fairly obvious hide when you're looking for it! Left Country Archer TB
